intro: Psilochenia atribarba subsp. cytotaxonomicorum, commonly known as the cytotaxonomic orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and genetic characteristics that set it apart from other members of the Psilochenia genus. It exhibits a distinctive chromosome number and structural variations that have been the focus of cytotaxonomic studies. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories, where it relies on specific mycorrhizal associations for nutrient uptake. Due to its limited distribution and genetic uniqueness, it is considered a valuable subject for research in plant systematics and conservation biology.
